Detailed Description

Definitions for semaphore operations.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_SEM_EA ( sem_var   )     ((ctk_sem_ea_t)(unsigned long)(&(sem_var)))

A macro to get a semaphore reference for the given semaphore variable.

Parameters:
[in] sem_var - a semaphore variable (ctk_sem_t)

#define CTK_SEM_PTR ( sem_ea   )     ((ctk_sem_t*)(unsigned long)(sem_ea))

A macro to get a pointer to the semaphore variable from the given semaphore reference.

Parameters:
[in] sem_ea - a semaphore reference (ctk_sem_ea_t)

#define CTK_SEM_VAR ( sem_ea   )     (*(ctk_sem_t*)(unsigned long)(sem_ea))

A macro to get a semaphore variable from the given semaphore reference.

Parameters:
[in] sem_ea - a semaphore reference (ctk_sem_ea_t)

Typedef Documentation

typedef volatile signed int ctk_sem_t __attribute__((aligned(128)))

semaphore type (must be aligned in a 128-bit line)

typedef ea_addr_t ctk_sem_ea_t

semaphore reference type

Function Documentation

int ctk_sem_create ( ctk_sem_ea_t *  sem,
unsigned int  value 
)

Creates a new semaphore reference. A new semaphore is allocated (by ctk_sync_alloc) and its reference is returned. (You can also directly declares a ctk_sem_t static variable and gets a reference for it using CTK_SEM_EA macro.)

Parameters:
[out] sem - a created semaphore reference.
[in] value - the initial value
Returns:
0 on success, errno on error

void ctk_sem_destroy ( ctk_sem_ea_t  sem  ) 

Destroys the given semaphore reference. Cond-var references created by ctk_sem_create must be destroyed by this routine.

Parameters:
[in] sem - a sem reference to be destroyed.

static int ctk_sem_get_value ( ctk_sem_ea_t  sem  )  [inline, static]

Returns the current semaphore counter value

Parameters:
[in] sem - semaphore whose value is returned.

int ctk_sem_init ( ctk_sem_ea_t  sem,
unsigned int  value 
)

Initializes the semaphore with the given value.

Parameters:
[in,out] sem - semaphore to be initialized.
[in] value - initial value for the semaphore.
Returns:
0 on success, errno on error

void ctk_sem_post ( ctk_sem_ea_t  sem  ) 

Increment the given semaphore.

Parameters:
[in,out] sem - semaphore to be incremented.

int ctk_sem_trywait ( ctk_sem_ea_t  sem  ) 

Decrement the given semaphore only if the semaphore is greater than zero.

Parameters:
[in,out] sem - semaphore to be decremented.
Returns:
0 if the semaphore is decremented, non-zero otherwise.

void ctk_sem_wait ( ctk_sem_ea_t  sem  ) 

Decrement the given semaphore if the semaphore is greater than zero. If the semaphore's value is zero, the calling thread will block until the value becomes greater than zero.

Parameters:
[in,out] sem - semaphore to be decremented.
